intro: Troxistemon fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant trefoil, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is native to parts of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant scent. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
